zone.line: Nature I unawares, called down a bles
sing on my own soul. But in a
city all is closed shut like a
prison, a wiry prison from which
you can peep at the sky only. I can
not describe to you what were the
frantic naut nature of my sensations
there while I resided there; I was often
on the verge of madness. Nay, when
I look back on many of my wild thoughts,
thoughts with which actions some-
times endeavoured to keep pace;
When I tossed my hands high cal-
ling down the cope of heaven to fall
on me and bury me; when I tore
my hair and throwing it to the
winds cried, "Ye are free, go seek my
father!" And then, like the unfortu
nate Constance, catching at them
again, ^and tying them up that nought might femd
find him if I might not. How, on
my knees I have co fancied myself
close to my fatherâ€™s grave and struck
